title: Thunderbird 38.2.0 Release

notes.note: Hardware acceleration is now disabled by default to avoid crashing Thunderbird
A few bugs have been fixed to avoid crashing Thunderbird
The "maildir" storage type can no longer be set through the UI due to various issues. Power users can still set the storage type using the config editor.

text: Thunderbird 38.2.0 contains underlying code that is based off of Firefox 38.2.0 esr. See also the release notes for the update from Thunderbird 31 to 38
system_requirements:
## Windows

### Operating Systems
 - Windows XP SP2
 - Windows Server 2003 SP1
 - Windows Vista
 - Windows 7
 - Windows 8
 - Windows 10

*Please note that while the 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows Vista and Windows 7 can be used to run Thunderbird, only 32-bit builds of Thunderbird are supported at this time.*

  
### Windows Recommended Hardware
   - Pentium 4 or newer processor that supports SSE2
   - 1GB RAM
   - 200 MB hard drive space

---

### Operating Systems
  
- Mac OS X 10.6
- Mac OS X 10.7
- Mac OS X 10.8

## GNU/Linux
### Software Requirements
  
  *Please note that Linux distributors may provide packages for your distribution which have different requirements.*
  
- Thunderbird will not run at all without the following libraries or packages:
 - GTK+ 2.18 or higher
 - GLib 2.22 or higher
 - Pango 1.14 or higher
 - X.Org 1.0 or higher (1.7 or higher is recommended)
 - libstdc++ 4.3 or higher
 - For optimal functionality, we recommend the following libraries or packages:
 - NetworkManager 0.7 or higher
 - DBus 1.0 or higher
 - HAL 0.5.8 or higher
 - GNOME 2.16 or higher
